About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you the star accountant on your team—the one everyone goes to when they hit a roadblock? Do you prefer to get hands-on with day-to-day finance tasks, rather than delegating them to lower-level workers? When your exceptionally sharp eye spots an error in an invoice, payment, or reconciliation, do you relentlessly investigate until you find the root cause? If so, we want you to join our 100% remote finance team.We're a notoriously high-margin, PE-funded software conglomerate building a revolutionary, world-class finance operation that runs 100% remotely on 24/7 global shifts. To achieve this, we are rapidly building a community of the world’s smartest and best finance professionals, and we need outstanding hands-on leadership to help our accountants and financial analysts be as strong as you are.If you are ready to take the next step in your career and be responsible for redesigning and improving the complex financial tasks you’re an expert at performing, then this is the role for you!What You Will Be Doing Completing transactions, preparing reports, building quotes, invoices, and purchase orders, applying incoming payments, managing cash positions, and paying suppliersLeading with your finance systems expertise; you will guide the team with the finance systems experience you’ve gained over the years and simplify the most complex tasks
What You Won’t Be Doing Project managing the work of low-level managers; we lead by doing, not by being hands-offOverseeing steady-state operations; you will never stop improving quality and productivity with deep knowledge and hard evidence
Basic RequirementsSenior Finance Controller key responsibilities CPA, ACA, ACCA, CIMA, CFA, MBA, or equivalentRecent experience as the top-performing accountant, auditor, or controller on your current team (if you haven't posted a transaction or built a financial model within the last year, please do not apply)3+ years of hands-on experience in each of the following areas: Accounts Payable (or PTP), Accounts Receivable (or OTC), Accounting (or RTR), Statutory/Management ReportingProfessional experience working with NetsuiteFamiliarity with generative AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Bard, Bing, Claude)The ability to commit to 40 hours of work per week with a regular, predictable work schedule

For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. executive team to create and execute a comprehensive growth plan.Innovative Campaigns: Identify opportunities to implement and innovate world-class digital campaigns that drive brand awareness and customer engagement.Channel Development: Identify and develop channel opportunities through strategic partnerships with technology providers.Performance Marketing: Take ownership of performance marketing initiatives, including paid search, social media advertising, and display advertising.Affiliate Marketing: Manage and execute affiliate marketing programs to expand our reach and drive conversions.ROI Optimization: Continuously monitor campaign performance, report results, recommend improvements, and iterate strategies to maximize ROI.A/B and MVT Experiments: Plan and run A/B and multivariate tests to optimize campaign elements and user experiences.Market Analysis: Identify market opportunities, threats, and challenges and take proactive measures to address them effectively.Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data, sales, and product, to align marketing efforts with overall business objectives.Requirements:Problem-Solving: A belief in and determination to solve complex problems and drive business growth.Digital Marketing Expertise: Strong understanding and passion for all aspects of digital marketing, including social media marketing, pay-per-click advertising, SEO/SEM, and analytics.Analytical Skills: Highly creative, data-driven, and analytical mindset with the ability to derive insights from data.Communication: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, both verbal and written.Web Analytics: Proficiency in website analytical tools to track and interpret user behavior.Coding: Understanding of coding languages (e.g., HTML, JavaScript) is a plus.Adaptability: A willingness to embrace a fail-forward mentality, learn from experiences, and continuously grow as a marketer.If you are a growth-oriented marketer with a proven track record of driving results in the digital space and are ready to take [Company Name] to new heights, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and be a crucial part of our journey toward success and innovation.

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented product people and engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our product people and engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.If you’re passionate about designing and delivering high-quality software, we'd love to hear from you.What You Will Be Doing Breaking down high-level milestones into requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteriaIterating with our designers to transform use cases and user stories into functional UX/UI prototypesTaking any important technical decisions you feel strongly about (e.g., data model, 3rd-party patterns to use)Reviewing and accepting engineering deliverables, ensuring it meets all of your requirements
What You Won’t Be Doing Chasing developers to get their work and tasks delivered on timeManaging people or completing HR & administrative tasksPerforming low-level exhaustive quality assurance work
Software Engineering Manager Key Responsibilities Create high-quality software releases by leveraging engineering talentEnsure the engineering deliverables snap together well and fully implement the milestoneImagine how users will interact with a product and develop robust use cases
Basic Requirements At least 3 years of hands-on experience working as a software engineer.Knowledge of relational database fundamentals and hands-on experience writing SQL.Experience defining product/technical requirements and peer reviewing/accepting engineering deliverables.An openness to learn to heavily use generative A.I. in your day-to-day work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day work (product or development).
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?Are you a marketing all-rounder, agile in your approach, and driven by the thrill of transforming abstract company goals into a killer digital strategy? If this resonates with you, this is your opportunity to enter at the ground level of a forward-thinking and well-funded startup as their first marketing hire.Picture this: an education startup poised to redefine K-12 education as we know it. Our secret weapon? Adaptive learning technology. We're on a mission to empower students from Kindergarten to 12th grade to master their academic workload in just 2 hours a day. But here's the kicker – they'll also be absorbing knowledge at double the pace, covering two years' worth of content in a single year. All this in a compact 120 minutes, encompassing math, reading, writing, science, and social studies.Our sights are set on a hands-on, full-stack marketing maestro who can navigate both the B2B private school landscape and the B2C realm. We don't want someone who will get lost in three-month research projects and churn out lengthy plans that gather digital dust. Key Responsibilities: Utilize your expertise to identify and engage potential candidates for various roles within our organization.Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their needs and develop targeted sourcing strategies.Source candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals.Conduct initial candidate assessments to ensure alignment with our values and job requirements.Maintain a talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs.Continuously improve and innovate sourcing processes to stay competitive in the global talent market.
 Requirements: Proven experience as a Sourcing Consultant or similar role.Strong sourcing and candidate engagement skills.Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.Familiarity with Pakistan's job market and talent landscape.Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote environment.A passion for immigration and international mobility is a plus.
 What We Offer: A dynamic and inclusive work environment.The opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in Pakistan.Performance-based compensation and incentives.Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.The chance to be part of a global network of experts in immigration and visa services.
Earning Opportunity: We offer a competitive earning opportunity, with monthly earnings ranging from PKR 30,000 to PKR 300,000, based on performance and results.
 If you are ready to make a significant impact in the field of global immigration and join a company that values your talent and expertise, we encourage you to apply! How to Apply: Interested candidates are invited to submit their resumes and a cover letter outlining their relevant experience to global.immigrationCC@gmail.com;  Global Immigration Consulting Center is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?Are you a marketing all-rounder, agile in your approach, and driven by the thrill of transforming abstract company goals into a killer digital strategy? If this resonates with you, this is your opportunity to enter at the ground level of a forward-thinking and well-funded startup as their first marketing hire.Picture this: an education startup poised to redefine K-12 education as we know it. Our secret weapon? Adaptive learning technology. We're on a mission to empower students from Kindergarten to 12th grade to master their academic workload in just 2 hours a day. But here's the kicker – they'll also be absorbing knowledge at double the pace, covering two years' worth of content in a single year. All this in a compact 120 minutes, encompassing math, reading, writing, science, and social studies.Our sights are set on a hands-on, full-stack marketing maestro who can navigate both the B2B private school landscape and the B2C realm. We don't want someone who will get lost in three-month research projects and churn out lengthy plans that gather digital dust. We need an intuitive marketer who formulates sharp hypotheses, tests them rapidly, learns from the outcomes, and scales their strategies. While you will own the entire gamut of strategic marketing, you'll have the freedom and resources to enlist agency support when execution demands it.This isn't just another job; it's an invitation to shape the future. Bring your expertise, your strategic mindset, and your forward-thinking acumen. We're not merely turning heads; we're pioneering a new chapter. If you're ready to step into the arena, seize the opportunity, and make a lasting impact in an EdTech startup, we want to hear from you.What You Will Be Doing Crafting and executing the company's market positioning and go-to-market strategiesDefining the target market, value proposition, and core marketing messagesHands-on creation and refinement of marketing content, ensuring its resonance with our brand voiceLeading collaborations with external teams and agencies, ensuring your strategic vision is effectively executedManaging, optimizing, and reporting on campaigns, ensuring their success by measuring against KPIs

About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a finance systems expert and a seasoned auditor or controller? Do you prefer to get hands-on with day-to-day finance tasks, rather than delegating them to lower-level workers? When you find key discrepancies while auditing statements or reviewing business performance reports, do you insist on diving into the ERP system to find the key issue? Do you lean on AI tools, such as ChatGPT, to boost your productivity at work? If you answered yes to these questions, we are interested in meeting you.In this role, you will be part of Trilogy’s finance function, which runs over 100 acquired software companies. We don’t run each company separately. Instead, we create a standard best practice for each task and process with a single, 100% remote team. That makes this job dramatically different. You will learn more in one month here than in a year working anywhere else.Most companies consider being global and 100% remote a liability and are currently suffering through a transition forced on them by the pandemic. We’re different. In the early 2000s, we recognized that going global and remote was “The Future of Work” and went all-in. It is true that moving to a global, remote environment is really hard - you need to completely replace synchronous processes with asynchronous ones, verbal communication with written, and ambiguous goals with clear task assignment and quality expectations. But once you do all that, you can unlock a 24/7, 4-shift, 4x pace of execution.You don’t need to be an asynchronous work expert. You simply need to be hard-working and hands-on, have solid accounting and finance fundamentals (US GAAP or IFRS), and love to automate and simplify processes. We will teach you the rest!What You Will Be Doing Completing transactions, preparing reports, building quotes, invoices, and purchase orders, applying incoming payments, managing cash positions, and paying suppliersLeading with your finance systems expertise; you will guide the team with the finance systems experience you’ve gained over the years and simplify the most complex tasks

Qualifications Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in sales, business development, or account management.Proven track record of meeting or exceeding revenue targets.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.Experience in the technology industry or with a global work marketplace is preferred.

              11-50 employees

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that’s looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsSoftware Development Engineer key responsibilities At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications.At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

You'll serve as a pillar of support for our development teams, championing innovation and collaborative problem-solving. When it comes to demystifying queries on storage virtualization or networking for our clients, your insights will be invaluable.At Skyvera, you're joining a community of forward-thinkers, collectively shaping the next chapter in telco software. If you're fueled by curiosity and driven by excellence, we invite you to be part of our journey!What You Will Be Doing Managing AWS accounts - creating, deleting, and optimizing resources to ensure efficiency and performanceProviding continuous support to the development team, aiding in deployment, infrastructure reliability, and troubleshootingOverseeing hardware BOQs - addressing and resolving customer queries related to hardware specifications and requirements
What You Won’t Be Doing Getting lost in isolated silos - at Skyvera, collaboration is keyConstant firefighting - we believe in proactive monitoring and preventionUsing outdated tools - we understand the importance of cutting-edge tools in DevOps
Technical Support Engineer Key Responsibilities Ensuring the seamless performance of our AWS development environments and driving customer satisfaction
Basic Requirements At least 3 years of experience as a DevOps engineerHands-on experience in managing and operating Linux-based virtual machines or instances within the AWS environment

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we see generative AI as more than a trend; we consider it the future scaffold of efficient software engineering. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and cloud computing once were. If you're a seasoned software engineer with a keen interest in AI technologies, this role offers you a unique opportunity to blend your skills in both domains.Unlike many companies that only scratch the surface of AI's potential, Trilogy places a strong emphasis on the practical integration of generative AI into our engineering processes. Our methods aim for quick and tangible results, focusing on reusing and fine-tuning existing AI models to improve engineering outcomes.The primary responsibility in this position would be to develop a framework that effectively leverages AI tools within our engineering process. About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?Are you a marketing all-rounder, agile in your approach, and driven by the thrill of transforming abstract company goals into a killer digital strategy? If this resonates with you, this is your opportunity to enter at the ground level of a forward-thinking and well-funded startup as their first marketing hire.Picture this: an education startup poised to redefine K-12 education as we know it. Our secret weapon? Adaptive learning technology. We're on a mission to empower students from Kindergarten to 12th grade to master their academic workload in just 2 hours a day. But here's the kicker – they'll also be absorbing knowledge at double the pace, covering two years' worth of content in a single year. All this in a compact 120 minutes, encompassing math, reading, writing, science, and social studies.Our sights are set on a hands-on, full-stack marketing maestro who can navigate both the B2B private school landscape and the B2C realm. We don't want someone who will get lost in three-month research projects and churn out lengthy plans that gather digital dust. We need an intuitive marketer who formulates sharp hypotheses, tests them rapidly, learns from the outcomes, and scales their strategies. While you will own the entire gamut of strategic marketing, you'll have the freedom and resources to enlist agency support when execution demands it.This isn't just another job; it's an invitation to shape the future. Bring your expertise, your strategic mindset, and your forward-thinking acumen. We're not merely turning heads; we're pioneering a new chapter. If you're ready to step into the arena, seize the opportunity, and make a lasting impact in an EdTech startup, we want to hear from you.What You Will Be Doing Crafting and executing the company's market positioning and go-to-market strategiesDefining the target market, value proposition, and core marketing messagesHands-on creation and refinement of marketing content, ensuring its resonance with our brand voiceLeading collaborations with external teams and agencies, ensuring your strategic vision is effectively executedManaging, optimizing, and reporting on campaigns, ensuring their success by measuring against KPIs
What You Won’t Be Doing Running carbon copy campaigns that lacks innovationProducing repetitive, boilerplate reports without fresh insightsMicromanaging junior team members without focusing on the bigger strategic pictureRelying too heavily on agencies without any personal involvement or overburdening yourself without delegating anything
Director Of Product Marketing Key ResponsibilitiesEstablishing a clear market footprint and voice for the company, ensuring alignment with our target audience in the private school and homeschooling sectorsBasic Requirements A minimum of 5 years of marketing experience for B2B companies or startupsExperience creating market positioning strategiesExperience developing and executing go-to-market strategiesExceptional content-creation abilities
About 2 Hour Learning2hr Learning is powered by AI technology that enables schools to provide personalized, mastery learning to students, enabling them to learn faster than standard school, thereby freeing up the rest of the school day to pursue their passions and interests.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that’s looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsTechnical Team Lead key responsibilities At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications.At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.

For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Grade Level: L3 Location: Islamabad Last date to apply: 22nd October, 2023 Who is the Manager ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance)? We are seeking a dedicated and motivated individual to join our Group ESG team - Environmental, Social, Governance - as Manager ESG. In this position, you will play a pivotal role in helping the Amsterdam and Dubai-based leadership in IR (Investors Relations) and ESG functions shape and execute VEON's ESG strategy. You will also help lead the delivery process of the Group's Integrated Annual Reports (IARs).  In your capacity as the ESG Manager, you will be the key interface between HQ and the OpCo's (the six VEON Operating Companies) on all ESG-related and IAR-related matters. This will include helping setup and manage the soon-to-be-established ESG Group Forum. Lastly, you will play a key role in managing the various third-party vendors that have been selected to support VEON through this journey. You will oversee the process surrounding the collection, assurance and disclosure of non-financial metrics that need to be published as part of the ESG and IAR requirements.  The ideal candidate will possess strong project management skills, a keen attention to detail, and the ability to foster cross-team collaboration. We are seeking a skilled individual who can help shape and co-lead the ESG strategy and execute against a bold and aggressive roadmap, in support of VEON's goal to implement a best-in-class ESG approach across all six OpCos and the Group. The role administratively reports to Head of Service Operations at Jazz and functional reporting lies with Amsterdam HQ (Group Director ESG and Integrated Reporting). What does the Manager ESG do?  Helps the Group Director lead the execution of VEON's ESG strategy. This includes a regular review of all legal and regulatory requirements in the VEON footprint, including disclosures mandated by the EU (such as CSRD) or by the US SEC. Review local OpCo disclosure requirements, if/when applicableCo-owns with the Group Director the preparation of VEON's Integrated Annual report. Helps project-manage the IAR end-to-end Takes the lead in all activities around the soon-to-be composed "VEON ESG forum": Setting up the agenda for the meetings Own the preparation of the presentations Prepare minutes of meeting and monitor the implementation of agreed action plans 
 Oversees the ESG data collection process (whether for IAR purposes or other ER disclosures), ensuring that data is timely and accurate. Helps with continuous improvement on the internal control environment for ESG reporting, so to ensure consistent, accurate and timely information as well as auditable and efficient reporting processes.Collaborates with external partners (such as third party Advisors and Assurance providers) as the key operational liaison person between the Group and those partners.Engages and communicates effectively with internal & external stakeholders, including OpCo executives, sponsors, and team members. Builds strong relationships with stakeholders to facilitate collaboration and support.
  Act as a main POC interface between the Group ESG Forum, the six Operating Companies, the HQ functional owners and the third-party vendors to manage the ESG metrics to be published in the Group's Integrated Annual Reports (IARs) Collaborates with the ESG Group Director and other key relevant external & internal stakeholders (Investor Relations, External Reporting, Legal) to ensure successful execution of all ESG / IR initiatives and tasks
 Jazz is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate, support, and thrive on diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.RequirementsWhat are we looking for and what does it require to be a Manager ESG? The ideal candidate would have:  Master's/Bachelor's in a relevant field such as, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Environmental Studies, Finance or Accounting.At least 7 - 10 years' experience of working in similar environment, that is delivery of the global/local implementations across VEON Operating Companies (or similar operating model), project management, data management and internal/external stakeholder management.Experienced in managing multi-national geographically distributed and cross-functional business and project teamsProven experience in project management, with a track record of successfully leading complex initiatives.Possessing an analytical approach towards handling project problems coupled with logic and reasoning.Excellent communication skills, including the ability to explain complex ESG concepts to diverse stakeholders.Previous experience of working in similar environment, that is delivery of the global/local implementations across VEON Operating Companies (or similar operating model) would be advantageous. This experience would demonstrate that the candidate is familiar with the unique challenges and intricacies of implementing projects within the VEON ecosystem, which could lead to a smoother and more efficient execution of tasks and projects.Understanding the structure, processes, and workings of VEON Operating companies (or similar operating model) can significantly reduce the learning curve for a new employee. Candidate would already have insights into the organization's culture, procedures, and expectations.Previous experience in delivering global/local implementations is a plus, as the candidate has enhanced its project management skills in this context. This is crucial for overseeing complex projects with multiple stakeholders.Experience in negotiating and collaborating with external partners.Demonstrated ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and collaborate with various departments.Proficiency in Power point or other advance presentation tools along with advanced Excel skills.Previous experience in financial or sustainability reporting is advantageous.Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.Very good at presenting analysis and insights to a broad audience, which may include ESG forum members or senior executive management.
BenefitsWhy Join Jazz? As one of the leading employers in the country, Jazz epitomizes the philosophy that each Jazz employee is passionately living a better every day inspired and enabled by visionary leadership, a unique professional culture, a flourishing lifestyle, and continuous learning and development. Our core values include qualities essential for a positive organizational culture - truthfully guiding entrepreneurial and innovative mindsets, harnessing professional and interpersonal collaboration, and fostering across-the-board customer-obsession. Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.

Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.

We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.

For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a customer support veteran who relies on deep technical experience and leadership skills? When a customer is unhappy, do you dig through individual support tickets and get knee-deep in granular details to discover the root cause of the problem? Do you try to stay ahead of the AI curve, using generative AI tools to help you write or debug code? If so, Trilogy's customer support team is the place for you!Trilogy built a fully remote support system based on customer obsession, a world-class knowledge base, and highly skilled agents capable of servicing over 10,000 customers on over 100 products. We count on our support managers to dive deep into the details and make the improvements that help the system achieve its full potential, and we lean on AI to help our customers solve problems autonomously instead of waiting around for an agent to become available.Our service is the #1 reason our customers continue to partner with us year after year, and our support leaders are responsible for making that service first-class. If you’re looking to take charge in a high-stakes environment, then we invite you to take the next big step in your career.What You Will Be Doing Conducting Deep Dives. You will dive into specific areas of support that are not currently meeting our quality bar (e.g., a decline in NPS or an increase in reopened tickets).Writing Improvement Proposals. You will make improvement recommendations based on your deep dive findings aimed at achieving 100% customer satisfaction.
What You Won’t Be Doing Specializing in specific products. From L1 agents all the way to the top, our organization provides stellar service to every customer on every product.Deferring to gut feeling and managerial instinct. We are a knowledge-driven organization, and our managers make decisions based on hard evidence.
Head Of Technical Support Key Responsibilities Ensuring the delivery of thousands of support tickets per week to tens of thousands of customers worldwide
Basic Requirements At least 5 years of technical customer support experienceAt least 3 years of experience writing code in a professional settingA proven ability to enhance your code using AI tools, such as Code Interpreter

Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
